title: Type suggestions for project on Morocco
content:
Hi everyone. Thanks in advance for any assistance you may be able to give.

I’m working on a (student) project where I’ll be creating a small exhibition  
space describing some aspects of Maroc.

While I will have some arabic text (for atmosphere), this exhibit would be  
geared to the English speaker, so I’ll need an English-langage typeface to  
deliver my information.

I’ll be discussing primarily the people and crafts of the country — and not  
the showcardianism of Bogey’s Casablanca, et al.

Any suggestions for type that might have some interesting features but  
remain readable? A touch of the arabesque without being campy?

Thanks again.

 [‹ Books on typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006111017/http:/typophile.com/node/17925 "Go to previous forum topic") [Extra Light Humanist Sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006111017/http:/typophile.com/node/17917 "Go to next forum topic")
author: arikawa

comments.content: Will there be lots of text to read? Is there a catalog, or just signage? Point sizes, media, lighting, etc.?

crossgrove,

good points. note that this will be a scale model repro, although  
that doesn’t lessen my necessity to be more specific.

no catalog. signage definitely, as well as some large text panels.  
i am not sure of the point size—which will vary by the face chosen—  
but open to suggestions of size/face pairings for easy viewing.

and yes, there were be a goodly amount of information, but probably  
no more than 1000 words distributed about the space (10’x10’x8’).

- off topic -

\> I’ll be discussing primarily the people and crafts of the country — and not  
the showcardianism of Bogey’s Casablanca, et al.

Good. I just hope that you’re going to talk about The Classic Book “Marrakesh dans les Palmes” - André Chevrillon (around the 1920s)

[ITC Barcelona](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006111017/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/itc-barcelona/).

random, but i think the word “Morrocco” looks quite nice and there’s a little bit of a cultural connection with the whole Spain/Morrocco thing…

—————  
nc

Wonderful suggestion istitch. I’ll definitely give Barcelona a try.

Any other suggestions, all?
I’d go for ITC Quorum — same league as Barcelona, obviously.
